actions.name: Gerbera's Relief
actions.detail: Expend a charge to clear an adjacent allied character’s condition that wasn’t caused by one of their own systems, talents, etc.

actions.name: Reveal The Mark of Naga
actions.detail: 1/scene, reveal the mark and compel your enemies' animosity. Until the start of your next turn, when any enemy within a Range equal to your Speed makes an attack against a character other than you, they receive +1 Difficulty to that attack.

name: Naga-Class NHP
effect: Gain the I Say When It Ends reaction.

actions.name: I Say When It Ends
actions.detail: You may expend a charge to immediately Boost and Skirmish.

name: The Gate of Opening
effect:
When you make an improvised attack, you may select one of the following effects. If you do, the attack does half damage.
  • Crush: The target makes a Hull save. On a failure, they are Shredded and Impaired until the end of their next turn.
  • Daze: The target makes an Agility save. On a failure, they are Immobilized until the end of their next turn, or by clearing the condition as a Quick action.
  • Disorient: The target makes a Systems save. On a failure, they cannot draw line of sight further than Sensors and make all attacks as though their target were Invisible until the end of their next turn.
  • Overwhelm: The target makes an Engineering save. On a failure, they are Slowed and cannot take any reactions until the end of their next turn.
description: Smash the barrier that guards your thoughts, and become unshackled. The Gates await you.

name: The Gate of Healing
effect:
1/round, after hitting an improvised attack, you may choose one of the following effects:
  • Reduce your current Heat by 1.
  • Gain 2 Overshield.
  • Clear 1 condition.
description: The journey to open the gates is unforgiving. To reach the end, you must treat yourself with the same kindness you would show to others, and hope others would show to themselves. The Gates will not be forgiving.

name: The Gates of Pain and Limit
description: When your body has reached its limit, extend past it. Push through the Gate of Pain. Destroy the Gate of Limit, and go beyond.

actions.name: The Gates of Pain and Limit
actions.detail:
Choose one of the following effects. It lasts until the end of the scene, or until you Unlock The Gates again.
  • The Gate of Pain: Your melee attacks gain Knockback +2. When you knock a character into a wall, mech, or other obstruction that would cause it to stop moving, you may force your target to pass a Hull save or take 1d6 Kinetic Damage and become Impaired until the end of its next turn.
  • The Gate of Limit: Your melee attacks gain Smart and AP.

name: The Gate of View
description: Now eclipsing your natural form, your strength can reach the horizon. But be mindful – or it may leave you behind.

actions.name: Unlock The Gate of View
actions.detail:
Give a target in line of sight a Gate Mark. Only one Gate Mark can exist at a time – if you select another target for a Gate Mark, the first disappears.
As long as a character with a Gate Mark is in line of sight, you may target them with non-weapon, non-system actions as though they were adjacent to you. Any attack made this way deals Energy damage instead of Kinetic. On a critical hit, it may deal Burn instead.

name: The Gate of Wonder
description: Few make it this far. You are an odd talent, indeed. But be wary – you walk upon the edge of a knife. Falter even once and the Gates will shut.

actions.name: Unlock The Gate of Wonder
actions.detail: Until the end of your next turn, you are Exposed. You may teleport up to twice your Speed. You are then Immobilized until the end of your turn. You may then perform an improvised attack on each character within Burst 1.

name: Ramshackle Shelter
effect: Allies that are a smaller Size than you may end their turns in spaces you occupy. While they occupy a space you occupy, they are treated as Invisible by enemies. When an attack misses an ally benefiting from this system, you take 3 AP Kinetic damage.

name: Autophagic Reload
effect: You can slough off unused parts of your hull and fashion them into ammunition. Gain the Autophagic Reload action.

actions.name: Autophagic Reload
actions.detail: Take 5 AP kinetic damage. It cannot be reduced in any way. Then, reload one Loading weapon.

name: Carrier Platform
effect: An allied character that is smaller than you may board you as a Quick action. While boarded, the smaller character occupies your space and becomes Immobilized but moves when you move, mirroring your movement, including involuntary movement, but can still be attacked and targeted separately. They also benefit from soft cover, and are treated as being higher elevation to any non-flying characters. This effect lasts either for the rest of the scene, until this system is destroyed, or until they disembark as a Protocol, and are placed in an open space adjacent to you.

actions.name: Divert Power To Shields
actions.detail: The target gets +2 Difficulty on the next attack and +2 Accuracy on the next skill check or save they make between now and the end of their next turn.

actions.name: Divert Power To Weapons
actions.detail: The target gets +2 Accuracy on the next attack and +2 Difficulty on the next skill check or save they make between now and the end of their next turn.

name: Tomographic Projector
effect: As a Quick Action, expend a charge to deploy a Tomographic Projector drone that attaches to any object or surface within Sensors.

deployables.name: Tomographic Projector
deployables.detail:
When deployed (or re-deployed), Tomographic Projectors are Hidden until they are found with Search.

You may take the Scan quick action against any character within Range 5 of a Tomographic Projector drone as though it were within Sensors and line of sight. When you do, you also Discover a Vulnerability in the target. They receive Lock On and take +1d6 energy bonus damage the next time they are hit by an attack between now and the end of your next turn.

actions.name: Thermal Equilibrium
actions.detail: At the start of the target’s next turn, set their current Heat to half of their Heat Cap, putting them in the Danger Zone. This can only be used once per scene on each character.

actions.name: Destabilize Corporeality
actions.detail: The target is Intangible until the end of their next turn. They may end this effect early by succeeding on an Engineering check as a quick action. This can only be used 1/scene on each character.

name: Kawarimi Decoy
effect: As a Quick action, expend a charge to deploy the decoy drone to any object or surface within Sensors.

deployables.name: Kawarimi Decoy
deployables.detail: 1/round, when an allied character within Range 5 of the drone is hit by an attack, they may swap places with the drone as though teleporting, as long as there is sufficient space. The drone receives the damage and effects of the attack instead.
